id.label: Name (required) ?Shows up as a column heading when you download your results. (ex: entering "phone" will store answers to this input in the phone column. If you use the phone name on other pages, those answers will overwrite what each user previously entered to keep your data up to date.) Don't use double quotes (").

Name (required) ?Shows up as a column heading when you download your results. (ex: entering "phone" will store answers to this input in the phone column. If you use the phone name on other pages, those answers will overwrite what each user previously entered to keep your data up to date.) Don't use double quotes (").

name.label: Name (required) ?Shows up as a column heading when you download your results. (ex: entering "phone" will store answers to this input in the phone column. If you use the phone name on other pages, those answers will overwrite what each user previously entered to keep your data up to date.) See the Radios section below for more detail on how data is stored. Don't use double quotes (").

radios.label: Radios ?One per line, must be unique. Don't leave blank lines -- blank lines will cause blank radio buttons. Checking a radio button with the text "Option 1" and the name (entered above) of "options" will store the value Option 1 under the options column. If you add | at the end of the line, any text after the | will be stored as the value instead. So "Option 1|option_1" will store option_1 under the options column when checked. Don't use double quotes (").

name.label: Name (required) ?Shows up as part of column headings when you download your results. See the Checkboxes section below for more detail on how data is stored. Don't use double quotes (").

checkboxes.label: Checkboxes ?One per line, must be unique. Don't leave blank lines -- blank lines will cause blank checkboxes. Checking a checkbox always stores a value of 1 but with a column name derived from the name box above and the checkbox name below. So checking a checkbox with the text "Option 1" and the name (entered above) of "options" will store the value 1 under the options_Option 1 column. If you add | at the end of the line, any text after the | will set the column name suffix. So "Option 1|option_1" will store 1 under the options_option_1 column when checked. Don't use double quotes (").

id.label: Name (required) ?Shows up as a column heading when you download your results. (ex: entering "phone" will store answers to this input in the phone column. If you use the phone name on other pages, those answers will overwrite what each user previously entered to keep your data up to date.) See the Options section below for more detail on how data is stored. Don't use double quotes (").

options.label: Options ?One per line, must be unique. Blank lines will create a blank option -- useful when making the select box required but forcing users to pick an option by leaving the top line blank. Choosing an option with the text "Option 1" and the name (entered above) of "options" will store the value Option 1 under the options column. If you add | at the end of the line, any text after the | will be stored as the value instead. So "Option 1|option_1" will store option_1 under the options column when chosen. Don't use double quotes (").
